g.H4191: to die (literally or figuratively); causatively, to kill
g.H2719: drought; also a cutting instrument (from its destructive effect), as a knife, sword, or other sharp implement
g.H1121: a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality ...
g.H1323: a daughter (used in the same wide sense as other terms of relationship, literally and figuratively)

g.H1961: to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
g.H3808: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
g.H7611: a remainder or residual (surviving, final) portion
g.H3588: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
g.H935: to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
g.H7451: bad or (as noun) evil (natural or moral)
g.H413: near, with or among; often in general, to
g.H582: a man in general (singly or collectively)
g.H6068: Anathoth, the name of two Israelites, also of a place in Pal
g.H8141: a year (as a revolution of time)
